Creates a label at position x, y, containing certain text

int CLabel::setStaticImage ( PhImage_t * image )
 

Sets the label to display a static image (i.e. image memory will not be freed)

int CLabel::setAcceleratorKey ( char * acceleratorKey )
 

Lets you underline the accelerator key within the widget's text string. You typically use this resource for hotkeys.

int CLabel::setBalloonText ( char * text )
 

Sets a custom text for the balloon. Calling this function will install an inflate callback

Defines the balloon's text color

int CLabel::setInflateFunction ( BallonInflateFunc_t inflateFunction )
 

Sets the function that inflates the balloon. This way, any balloon shape and behavior can be customized. Note: Another possibility is to derive a class and override the method inflateBalloon

int CLabel::setImageData ( PhImage_t * image )
 

If the label type is an image, this sets the image

int CLabel::setSelectShiftOn ( )
 

int CLabel::setSelectShiftOff ( )
 

int CLabel::isSelectShift ( )
 

Pt_LABEL_SELECT_SHIFT - if this is set, the text shifts down and to the right by one pixel when the widget is armed. Otherwise, the text doesn't shift.

int CLabel::setShowBalloonOn ( )
 

int CLabel::setShowBalloonOff ( )
 

int CLabel::isShowBalloon ( )
 

If the pointer remains motionless for 1.25 seconds over the label, a balloon pops up with the label's text.

int CLabel::setBalloonAsRequiredOn ( )
 

int CLabel::setBalloonAsRequiredOff ( )
 

int CLabel::isBalloonAsRequired ( )
 

Pt_BALLOON_AS_REQUIRED - same as Pt_SHOW_BALLOON, except the balloon is inflated only if the label is clipped by its parent container.

int CLabel::setTypeZString ( )
 

Pt_Z_STRING - use Pt_ARG_TEXT_STRING to display the text.

int CLabel::setTypeImage ( )
 

Pt_IMAGE - use Pt_ARG_LABEL_DATA to display an image. See PhImage_t in <PhT.h>. Set the flags member of the PhImage_t structure to: Ph_RELEASE_IMAGE | Ph_RELEASE_PALETTE | Ph_RELEASE_TRANSPARENCY_MASK | Ph_RELEASE_GHOST_BITMAP before providing the image to the widget. If you do this, the memory used for the image is released when the widget is unrealized or destroyed.

int CLabel::setTypeTextImage ( )
 

Pt_TEXT_IMAGE - display the image and text of the label.

int CLabel::setLineSpacing ( int lineSpacing )
 

The space, in pixels, between the lines of text in the label. The default is 0.

Space between the label's canvas and the canvas defined by the basic widget.

Sets the font to bold

int CLabel::setText ( char * text )
 

Sets the text that appears in the label Returns: 0 success, -1 error

int CLabel::setTextFromDouble ( double number,
char * format = "%g" )
 

int CLabel::setTextFromInteger ( int number,
char * format = "%d" )
 

Sets the text from a number, using printf format string Returns: 0 success, -1 error

int CLabel::setTextFromTime ( double seconds,
char * format = "%g" )
 

Sets the text from a time in seconds. Uses time format "hh:mm:ss.ms" as required The format string is the same as the one used for printf and is used for the seconds display. A "s" at the end of the format string results in the adding of "sec", "min", "hrs" and "days" to the text Returns: 0 success, -1 error

int CLabel::setTextFromPath ( char * path )
 

Sets the text from a file path. If the full path doesn't fit the label, ellipses are displayed instead of the top level of the path

char * CLabel::getText ( )
 

Gets the text of the label

double CLabel::getTextAsDouble ( )
 

Gets the text of the label and converts it to a double

int CLabel::getTextAsInteger ( )
 

Gets the text of the label and converts it to an integer

double CLabel::getTextAsTime ( )
 

Gets the text in dd:hh:mm:ss format and converts it to number of seconds
